conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and an angled/isometric viewpoint exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and room volumes; good corner geometry and cutaway. Minor simplification in some wall top/edge detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: kitchen/living on left, bedroom upper area, central bath/core, and stairs on right. Some perimeter opening segmentation and a few doorway placements/sizes appear simplified versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (bed, sofa, table), kitchen elements (cabinets + island) and bathroom fixtures represented; overall scale and orientation are reasonable with minor simplification.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with consistent materials and lighting. Text labels inside the 3D render reduce presentation cleanliness; some glazing/openings are visually simplified.

detected_errors.description: Door/window/opening locations and segmentation are partially simplified; several perimeter window segments in the 2D plan are not faithfully replicated as discrete openings in the 3D.
Text labels (e.g., room names) are embedded in the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness per rubric.

summary: A genuine isometric cutaway 3D conversion with strong layout fidelity, with minor deviations in door/window detailing and added text labels affecting presentation.
